definition: to conclude a treaty/to make an agreement/contract (at bridge)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: He has to draw spades first in order to make the contract.
sentences.chinese: 为了完成定约墩数，他得先吊黑桃。

sentences.english: Five no-trump asked North to pick a slam.
sentences.chinese: 5NT是让北家选择一个满贯定约。

sentences.english: Modern bridge known as contract bridge.
sentences.chinese: 现代桥牌称为定约桥牌。

sentences.english: Only perfect defense could set four spades.
sentences.chinese: 只有出色的防守才能打宕四黑桃的定约。

sentences.english: You're a contractor in this part of the agreement, remember that.
sentences.chinese: 你是这部分协议的定约人，记住这一点哦。

sentences.english: The player who first named the suit (or no-trump) is the declarer.
sentences.chinese: 最先叫出最后定约花色或无将的牌手为庄家。

sentences.english: We set them two tricks at four spades.
sentences.chinese: 我们使他们的四黑桃定约宕了两墩。

sentences.english: It 's correct to take the safest play for the contract AT rubber bridge .
sentences.chinese: 在盘式桥牌中，用最保险的打法完成定约是正确的。

sentences.english: We set them two tricks at four spades.
sentences.chinese: 只有出色的防守才能打宕四黑桃的定约。

definition: to reach an agreement/to agree upon
secret appointment
to conclude a treaty
to keep a promise/to honor an agreement
security deposit/earnest money (real estate)/good-faith deposit
to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
to start a war/to open hostilities
to give one's assent/to consent
to fight
to become engaged/to affiance (a daughter)
to promise/to consent (to do sth)
contract/written agreement
to bring together/to mediate/to arrange a deal
to have a prior engagement
to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
to make a contract
